data.title: Iconic actress Una Stubbs has sadly died aged 84
data.meta_description: Iconic actress Una Stubbs has sadly died aged 84, her family have confirmed. She appeared in shows such as Sherlock, EastEnders and Worzel Gummidge.
data.text:
Very sad news

Sad news today (Thursday 12th August), as it's been confirmed that popular actress Una Stubbs has passed away at the age of 84.

Una, who has starred in TV shows such as Sherlock, EastEnders and Worzel Gummidge during her extensive career, sadly passed away at her home in Edinburgh surrounded by her family.

Her sons Joe and Christian Henson and Jason Gilmore said in a statement: "Mum passed away quietly today with her family around her, in Edinburgh. We ask for privacy and understanding at this most difficult and sad of times."

Her agent Rebecca Blond added: "We are desperately sad to have lost not only a wonderful actress, whose screen and stage career, spanning over 50 years, was so extraordinarily varied, from Till Death Us Do Part to Sherlock, as well as memorable performances in the West End, at the Old Vic, Donmar Warehouse, Sheffield Crucible and National Theatre, but also a wickedly funny, elegant, stylish, graceful, gracious and kind and constant friend.

"She was also a highly respected and exhibited artist."

Born on 1st May in 1937, Una made her TV debut in 1956, appearing as one of the Dougie Squires Dancers on the British television music show Cool for Cats.

The aspiring actress then landed her first major screen role in Cliff Richard's 1963 movie Summer Holiday, with the actress going on to appear in his 1964 movie Wonderful Life.

After appearing as Aunt Sally in Worzel Gummidge, Una also enjoyed roles in popular shows such as EastEnders. Keeping Up Appearances, Heartbeat, Casualty, Midsomer Murders and Benidorm.

Most recently, Una appeared as Mrs Hudson in BBC drama Sherlock.

Remembering all of the other famous faces we've lost in 2021:

Our thoughts are with Una's family and friends at this sad time.
